You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Manage the Storefront Header

Provide a trusted storefront experience that follows conventional website design and provides options for buyers to quickly access their account information from any page.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
USER EXPERIENCE COMPATIBILITY
Interface	Bootstrap 3 or classic
Pages	All pages
Page layouts	Any page layout
User visibility	Logged-in users and guest users (depending on your storefront's guest user access)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

The header can include the following information:

Logo image for your storefront's brand (1), which links to your storefront's specified Home page. To specify this image, use CSS in your storefront's custom theme.
NOTE In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13), you can configure one of the following destinations for Home page links:
The storefront's default Home page
An Experience Builder site Home page
A custom URL

See Specify the Destination for Links to Your Storefront's Home Page.

Locale Switcher widget (2) for a storefront supports multiple locales. To set up this widget in the header, see Show the Locale Switcher Widget.
Effective Account Selector (not shown) for a storefront that allows a buyer to log in on behalf of accounts other than their own. To set up this widget in the header, see Show the Effective Account Selector.
Link to the My Account page (3), where a buyer can manage their contact information, addresses, payments, order history, and so on. The My Account page is only accessible for an authenticated buyer.
Link to the Shopping Cart page (4), which also shows the number of items currently in the buyer's cart and the cart's subtotal amount. Optionally, you can skip the remote action that calculates this cart information.
Search Box widget (5) for a buyer to search your product catalog. Optionally, you can hide this search box and instead show a Search widget in a page column. To set up this widget in the header, see Show the Search Box Widget.
Logout link (6) for an authenticated buyer.
TIP You can also optionally disable the header entirely, which removes these options from any page where the header isn't available. Disabling the header doesn't hide the navigation bar, which contains your storefront's menus and menu items.

To manage the user experience for the header, update your storefront configuration settings:

On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Header (3).
To make sure that the header appears, find the Enabled configuration (4), and make sure that is value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Header
Configuration	Enabled
Page	all
Value	TRUE
To skip calculating the cart item count and subtotal for the Shopping Cart page link, find the Skip Remote Action configuration (6). Make sure that its value is TRUE (7).
NOTE By default, skipping the remote action doesn't hide the number of items or subtotal, but shows only a zero amount for both values: 
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Header
Configuration	Skip Remote Action
Page	all
Value	TRUE
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
SEE ALSO

title: Managing Storefront Headers in Salesforce B2B Commerce
